1.text: Do not imitate evil men, nor desire to be among them.

2.text: For their mind meditates on robberies, and their lips speak deceptions.

3.text: By wisdom shall a house be built, and by prudence shall it be strengthened.

4.text: By doctrine, the storerooms shall be filled with every substance that is precious and most beautiful.

5.text: A wise man is strong, and a well-taught man is robust and valiant.

6.text: For war is undertaken in an orderly manner, and safety shall be where there are many counsels.

7.text: Wisdom is beyond the foolish; at the gate he will not open his mouth.

8.text: Whoever intends to do evil shall be called foolish.

9.text: The intention of the foolish is sin. And the detractor is an abomination among men.

10.text: If you despair, being weary in the day of anguish, your strength will be diminished.

11.text: Rescue those who are led away to death. And do not cease from delivering those who are dragged away to a violent death.

12.text: If you would say: “I do not have sufficient strength.” He who inspects the heart, the same one understands, and nothing slips past the one who preserves your soul. And he shall repay a man according to his works.

13.text: My son, eat honey, because it is good, and the honeycomb, because it is so sweet to your throat.

14.text: So, too, is the doctrine of wisdom to your soul. When you have found it, you will have hope in the end, and your hope shall not perish.

15.text: Do not lie in wait, and do not seek impiety in the house of the just, nor spoil his rest.

16.text: For the just one will fall seven times, and he shall rise again. But the impious will fall into evil.

17.text: When your enemy will fall, do not be glad, and do not let your heart exult in his ruin,

18.text: lest perhaps the Lord see, and it displease him, and he may take away his wrath from him.

19.text: Do not contend with the most wicked, and do not be a rival to the impious.

20.text: For the evil hold no hope in the future, and the lamp of the impious will be extinguished.

21.text: My son, fear the Lord, as well as the king. And do not mingle with detractors.

22.text: For their perdition shall up rise suddenly. And who knows what ruin will be for each of them?

23.text: Likewise, these things are for the wise. It is not good to base judgment on knowledge of character.

24.text: Those who say to the impious, “You are just,” shall be cursed by the people, and the tribes shall detest them.

25.text: Those who argue against the impious shall be praised, and a blessing shall come upon them.

26.text: He shall kiss the lips, who responds with upright words.

27.text: Prepare your outdoor work, and diligently cultivate your field, so that afterward, you may build your house.

28.text: Do not be a witness without cause against your neighbor. And do not mislead anyone with your lips.

29.text: Do not say, “I will do to him as he has done to me.” I will repay each one according to his work.

30.text: I passed by the field of a lazy man, and by the vineyard of a foolish man,

31.text: and behold, it was entirely filled with nettles, and thorns had covered its surface, and the stonewall was destroyed.

32.text: When I had seen this, I laid it up in my heart, and by this example, I received discipline.

33.text: You will sleep a little,” I said. “You will slumber briefly. You will fold your hands a little, so as to rest.

34.text: And destitution will overtake you like a runner, and begging will overtake you like an armed man.”
